website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch network card that allows you to quickly connect a desktop computer to a high-speed wired network.
pros: Compatible with Windows XP, Vista, Windows 7, and Windows 8
Comes with a full-sized bracket attached and a spare low profile bracket for easy installation
More affordable than many comparable options
cons: Installing drivers may prove to be a long, arduous process

customer_reviews.title: Effective and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This Network Adapter is a life changer for me. For years I have paid for 300mbps+ speeds on my Internet. I recently realized I was maxing out at 100mbps thus spending money unnecessarily. My issue was my Network Adapter that was a part of my Motherboard. Buying this adapter allows me to use the most of the MBPS I am paying or. I am averaging 294mbps using this adapter and I couldnt be happier. I can finally watch 4k and 8k videos without a ton of buffering. Installation was straight forward and anyone should be able to accomplish in 5 minutes or less. I highly recommend this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Shwell

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare - DOA
customer_reviews.text: This review is about the TP-Link 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Ethernet PCI Express, PCIE Network Adapter / Network Card / Ethernet Card. Unfortunately, the reviews on the product page are a mixture of any one of many devices. This antique didn't install and the system could not find it or recognize it. The installation instructions mentioned Windows Xp, so that gave me some indication of the age of this obsolete design. I don't think it's plug and play and the driver (latest downloaded from the manufacturer's site) didn't install it. Funny, the read-me file said something about realtec and not TP-Link. So, I recommend you look elsewhere for something designed in the last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Berman

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solved
customer_reviews.text: We arrived home to find an Outage from Comcast....However, upon further Investigation, the Gateway & Cable Box were NOT Powering On...... After getting the new Hardware I Discovered Our Desktop had No Internet, changed Ethernet Cables...NOTHING...The Spike Went through The Backup Power Supply,Surge Protector, the Gateway, The Cable and Fried our Motherboard Embedded LAN Circuit.... Our Computer is 2005..... Out Of Options.... Smart Phone Google and 2 Seconds Later I FOUND THIS....Prime One Click !!......2 Days Later and Literally 6 Minutes to Install the Board and Software Update from Micro CD.....INTERNET TO POST THIS FREAKING AWESOMENESS REVIEW !!! Our Computer is Resurrected AGAIN until 2020 when Windows 7 NO LONGER Will Get Microsoft Updates....THANK YOU !!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and comes with drivers on a miniCD.
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation and it worked great to replace a built-in NIC on the motherboard that was failing. The best part was the drivers were provided on a mini CD. We didn't end up needing them but it's very useful if you've ever installed a card that wasn't detected and installed automatically and then had to go to another machine to download the drivers and come back because you couldn't download them on the machine you just installed the card in because you had no internet connection. That alone will make me buy this product if I find myself in need of a network card again.
customer_reviews.author: McGanskiRules

customer_reviews.title: Much more stable and faster then Intel onboard adapter!
customer_reviews.text: Received item on time, packaged well and in perfect condition. Really quick install with directions easy to understand, which is hard to get now a days! It did automatically load windows drivers for this device, but I uninstalled them and loaded cd drivers. Ran a speed test before I installed new adapter and I was getting about 65Mbps. Ran it again with the new adapter and I got 201Mbps, so I'm pretty content with that! Ran a wifi speed test also right next to the Modem and got 256Mbps. Not going to complain. I would definitely recommend this product, especially over Intel.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this card and it is way smaller then I thought but it installed just fine. Came with a half height bracket, install guide and mini CD with drivers. Driver was easy to install as find the one you need and right click from windows and install. Good choice to buy one or two for a backup in case you loose you built in NIC on a Mobo. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: G Turek

customer_reviews.title: Wired Ethernet is ALWAYS BETTER
customer_reviews.text: If you have a big desktop, do EVERYTHING you can to use a wired network connection. It is and always will be superior to a WiFi connection. The problem will NEVER be a baby monitor, a drone, or a rogue microwave oven in the neighborhood. You will always have speed and reliability, and you never have to worry about things on your end. I didn't have to install drivers, it just WORKS in Linux and Windows. In fact, I'd suggest NOT installing any drivers from the vendor, just let the OS handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: PCI may work better than PCI-E in old computers
customer_reviews.text: I believe my 2010 Dell Desktop was too old for this PCI-E NIC (network interface card) , as it had to be cold-booted at least every other day to get back on Internet. So I replaced it with a PCI from Amazon and now all okay: StarTech.com 1 Port PCI 10/100/1000 32 Bit Gigabit Ethernet Network Adapter Card (ST1000BT32) PCI Express (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), officially abbreviated as PCIe or PCI-e, is a high-speed serial computer expansion bus standard, designed to replace the older PCI, PCI-X and AGP bus standards.
customer_reviews.author: Clay W

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: ...I was paying for 200Mbps internet but was seeing no more than 60 or 70 Mbps. My computer couldn't deliver the 200 Mbps speed with it's installed ethernet card. I am no computer tech but I looked into and decided to try this item out. I amazed myself by being able to actually install it. I was further amazed at how it seems to be doing the job...I am now up to 190Mbps with this card. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: DarrylS

customer_reviews.title: Gigabit PCI-E Card: Ancient Install Instructions, But Works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a secondary internet port to insure that my main computer can communicate with my router. It serves that purpose. That said, the directions are ANCIENT: written for Windows 7. Presumably the included mini-CD's software is just as old. I do expect a tech product to have directions for current operating systems, not ones that expired a decade ago. But my Win 10 machine recognized the device, installed drivers without apparent download, and it is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Dog's Boy on the Sunny Southern OR Coast

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation - no config required
customer_reviews.text: My onboard network adapter got zapped during a power outage. Although my computer could still access my network, I simply could not get a response from the internet. I ordered this device, physically installed it, and powered up my windows 7 machine with the driver disk at hand, ready for a configuration battle. Upon arriving at the desktop, windows detected the card, installed the drivers on it's own and that's it - done. Other then inserting the card, securing the screw, and plugging in my network cable, that's all that was required. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapskate

customer_reviews.title: Nice bump for an old desktop going to Gig Ethernet from 100/10Mbps. Easy, no drama install.
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the TG-3468 wired in-case card. I just needed to get to Gig Ethernet on an older DELL in the household that was only 100/10Mbps. Thankfully there was a mini-pcie slot on the mobo and I just plugged it in and Windows 10 Pro found the drivers and installed, no drama. Now I'm moving around my dataset nightly for backups at a more palatable speed. Recommended. (j4.)
customer_reviews.author: John IV

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect with Windows 10 64bit ... if you have problems try disabling motherboard ethernet
customer_reviews.text: 2018-08-04 .... TP-Link TG-3468 Gigabit Ethernet PCI-Express Network Adapter Card for PC ....Windows 10 64bit ...... Windows installed it, had to disable motherboard native RJ45 and then this worked perfect . . . .. . for more than a year, I had noticed that my downloads, sometimes were blazingly fast and at other times the downloads just chugged slowly along, I blamed the internet ... and then it just stopped connecting. Windows isolated trouble to bad cord. I replaced 'bad-cord' with known good cord; no change. All types of manipulation, no change. I bought this adapter and we are blazingly fast all the time..... Coincidence? We had lightning strike in the yard the day before the motherboard's RJ45 stopped connecting.
customer_reviews.author: BackLot

customer_reviews.title: Works, but software is bad
customer_reviews.text: This installed physically into a desktop. I used the included "short" mounting plate, so that worked fine. However, the included mini-disk of "software drivers" was a joke. No exe file, just a useless data file. I was able to use onboard drivers, recognized by Windows 10, so the adapter works. The hardware seems fine, the software, if you need it, is poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Dell XPS 8300 windows update killed my driver
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the same day delivery of this network adapter. Works exactly like it should. I figured out how to disable the destruction from the TAP Win32 adapter from a February 2020 Windows10 update and configured it back to my broadcom oem adapter but since it is on the motherboard, I decided to replace it anyway. Thanks Amazon! Can't live without internet now.
customer_reviews.author: APPsmom

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 2nd NIC to turn an old slim factor PC into a router, and this fit the bill perfectly. After swapping the standard bracket for the included low profile bracket it installed easily and the PfSense router OS recognized it no problem due to the Realtek chipset which turned out to be the same one built into the machine's motherboard. Flawless operation! Realtek based network cards have never failed to work for me over almost 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired technology manager so when my on-board Ethernet on my desktop bit the dust, I needed a simple and fast repair. I had experience with TP-Link products so the choice was simple. Easy to install and no software required (Windows had built in drivers). All I had to do was turn off the on-board Ethernet (done thru startup setup choice on my Dell desktop) and I was back to running at gigabit speed. At $14.99 it was a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Hayes

customer_reviews.title: 10 meg connection was all it will give me
customer_reviews.text: bought this to use instead of the on-board controllers, they are starting to go bad. on board Realtech controllers where giving 250mbs, but where starting to experience drop outs and lag spikes..etc. this when installed dropped speeds to a crawl. win 7 would not install the drivers from the disk, but instead used a different realtech driver. Returning this and going to try and intel.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact I was able to install it on my old desktop HP Pavilion pc running Linux without having to worry about downloading drivers. My computer's original Ethernet card is only rated for 100 megabit speed, but I needed this new card rated at 1000 megabit to take advantage of the internet provider speed upgrade. So far it works great.
customer_reviews.author: AmatureOldFolks

customer_reviews.title: Very good for PCs with ethernet port issues
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother's PC who's motherboard Ethernet port was destroyed somehow. Nobody knows how, just doesn't work anymore. Anyway, it was super simple to set up the driver for it and get his PC fully updated. Recommended for anyone having similar issues. Getting a new motherboard isn't the solution to this. (Although if you have several problems you really probably should get a new MB)
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, Free BSD firewall software supports drivers for this card
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for firewall I was building. My internet speed is 300 Mbs. When I put the firewall between my router and my FIOS system, I got the same 300 Mbs up and down. So the card worked for my application. The firewall software (based on Free BSD) recognized the card and installed the correct drivers. So I did not have to search for the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE WITH LINUX
customer_reviews.text: I was leery about buying this as they have no support for linux. Not only did linux detect the adapter, but reported back the correct make, model number, and correct speed, and all this right out of the box, no driver installation or configuration. If you need to replace your adapter on a old computer, this is the one for you. It probably works fine with windows also. THUMBS ALL UP!!
customer_reviews.author: g.harrised

customer_reviews.title: Almost line rate tested
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement 1Gig Mbps NIC as my on MB NIC finally failed. I knew the internal hardware could handle the speeds as the on board NIC, when it worked prior, was almost 1Gig line rate. I was hoping for a NIC that would at least handle 400Mbps line rate. I probably should add this is for my Plex Windows 10 machine at my house. My Internet provider is currently set to 400Mbps. I know I'll never push/stream anywhere near close to that rate, but I wanted my Plex to handle whatever the network would support. I'm proud to say, I'm actually able to get well over 900Mbps, and most of my internal tests are 946Mbps+.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Internet at the speed of light!
customer_reviews.text: The picture says it all.... With Windows 10 it was a breeze, plugged the card in, fired up the computer and it found the card right away, without even needing the installation CD. I still searched out and installed the latest driver. In the picture you see the result, what more could you ask for? My service is 1 Gig up/down fiber optic. I've never gotten better numbers then I have with this Card.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Darrah

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad's computer as a lightning strike near the house fried the Ethernet port on his motherboard. As soon as the card was delivered, I installed it in an available PCIe port, turned the computer on and immediately had an Internet connection. Couldn't have gone smoother.
customer_reviews.author: fractalsauce

customer_reviews.title: Works in a HP Pavilion p6624y
customer_reviews.text: The HP I have only has an integrated 10/100 network chip but I have 300mb/s cable internet. Long story short, this card worked automatically after I rebooted the system a 2nd time. I went over to Speedtest and I was getting the download and ping speeds I should be getting. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wired ethernet card that works and is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased (and received) an ethernet card for wired connections. I purchased this card because a lightning hit took out my PC (and a bunch of other stuff). The PC was fine except the ethernet port. So I purchased this card. It arrived quickly, I plugged this Card in, connected an ethernet cable to my router, booted windows 10 and the PC was back on the network. I want to emphasize this review is for the wired ethernet card, not a Wifi card., so I can’t rate Wifi signal, and I didn’t need tech support either. This product is doing what I need for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and it worked out of the box in my very old Dell box. Saved me from needing to upgrade my system for another couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: C S Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is an Ethernet Card!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon, this is an ethernet card. I can't rate it on the WIFI signal. I didn't have to use Tech support so, I can't rate that either. It was easy to install and set up on my wife's computer. I am a computer technician so I can tell your customers that I own many TP-Link products and have had no problems out of any os them.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Geimer

customer_reviews.title: Worked on Netware - anyone heard of Netware?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card because it specifically mentioned Netware compatibility in the Amazon description. Good thing I didn't research harder, because the disk that comes with the card has NO mention of Netware or Novell. However, I figured to put it in the server where the on-board LAN connection had failed. Nothing to lose, and I had the card in hand. To my delight and utter amazement, the Q57.LAN driver that had been in use on the HP Proliant ML310 server worked on this card, and I was able to get clients reconnected to the server again. This is a surprise all around, as there is not even one instance of the word "Netware" or "Novell" on the TP-Link website.
customer_reviews.author: W. Frush

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: If your motherboard's ethernet port is not working properly, then I would say this is a great replacement for your fast speed internet. I have used TP-Link products in the past and I am happy I found this one. I would highly recommend it to anyone who needs a replacement for there ethernet port.
customer_reviews.author: Kartal

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: The ethernet port on my motherboard went out and I got sick of having packet loss on wifi so I got this little guy. Popped it into my PCIe x1 slot and it's been smooth sailing ever since. If you have a tower and a slot to fill, I say skip the USB ethernet adapters and go straight to PCIe.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hood

customer_reviews.title: Good solid ethernet card
customer_reviews.text: I brought this because of the ethernet adapter on my motherboard broke. Originally I was looking for the wifi version, but all those small and cheap one are destined to fail in half an hour because of overheat, and the big one with heat sink are expensive. And suddenly I realized "why not just get the basic one that gets the job done?" And this card worked as expected, solid and stable.
customer_reviews.author: singjipie

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, Good Performance and Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Needed to convert a desktop PC to wireless. I really like TP-Link products--never had any issues with build quality or performance. Really easy install, Windows 10 instantly saw the device (no software install needed) and has very good performance. A winner.
customer_reviews.author: John Y.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for pfsense.
customer_reviews.text: It's a realtek chip which probably works fine for windows. But I bought this to use with pfsense which is freebsd based and it does not work for pfsense. It will recognize the card as an ethernet card but no traffic will route through it. Get it if you need a cheap lan card for windows. But it won't work for pfsense.
customer_reviews.author: M.Olson

customer_reviews.title: With Windows 10 easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install on a 7 year old dell 8300. Internal Ethernet card final blew out. Replaced with this one. Loaded the drivers reboot the Dell and was back on the internet. Even upgraded to USB 3.0 . I'm very happy with the card.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had all sorts of problems with all the onboard (mostly Intel) NIC's in all my PC's. These issues were made very obvious by my network monitoring software, PRTG. It recorded lots of random downtimes for all sorts of PC's and various devices, even my network equipment itself (such as the administrative interfaces on my switches). Put these NIC's in all my PC's (includign my PRTG server, of course) and all problems are gone. Very nice. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: buttersh

customer_reviews.title: TP link quality
customer_reviews.text: Card plugged into PCIe slot and windows 10 picked it up from there. No problems as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace on board lan. Easy to install, windows 10 found the drivers immediately. Did not need any tech support. This product is not wireless, it is for wired lan.
customer_reviews.author: April K

customer_reviews.title: Defective product. No response from Amazon on inability to return this item.
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to install this card on an Asus Windows 7 system, the computer refused to boot. When I removed it, the computer started up just fine. Amazon returns stops functioning as soon as I click the continue button. Product support does not respond. From now on I'll stick with Startech on Newegg.com.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Berger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome network card!
customer_reviews.text: I build all my gaming computers and this card is awesome! I boosted my Mbps from avg 300 Mbps to 500 - 1000 Mbps! I am very impressed. To use this card in your PCIE slot, you must disable your onboard motherboard network adapter in the BIOS first. Do not forget this! Take care...
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use!
customer_reviews.text: I recently returned another brand of adapter that failed in several irritating ways, so I was skeptical about the Techkey product from the start. However, after a quick-click installation that worked flawlessly the first time, I was pleasantly surprised to find my Android device's Link to Windows functions also worked the first time I tried them, and they've continued to work ever since. Thanks for a good product and a great install experience, Techkey!
customer_reviews.author: Joe and Marge Melton

customer_reviews.title: not deteced by ESXi 6.7
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a great product for users other than VMWare. I just wanted to share, this was not deteced by VMWare ESXi 6.7 vSphere Hypervisor (ESXi) 6.7 Driver Rollup (Includes VMware Tools)
customer_reviews.author: Jason Madruga

customer_reviews.title: Easy to laugh install and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Was a breeze to install and it increased my speed a little. My mom onboard adapter died on my msi b360 motherboard. So I ordered this as a replacement. Works great , no complaints. If you find yourself needing a network card, this will not disappoint you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This card worked much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This card worked much better than expected! I'm paying for 105 Mbps speed from Comcast. The highest speed I'd ever gotten from my Ethernet connection was 87 Mbps. I recently found out it was because my computer's network adapter card was only a 10/100 Mbps card. I installed this device and booted up my machine running Windows 10. The computer never asked for a new driver. I connected my Ethernet cord to this card and ran a Comcast speedtest. BOOM! I was now downloading at 125 Mpbs.! I can't ask for anything more, especially at the low price I paid for this card. I hope your installation will be as easy and successful!
customer_reviews.author: AlanD

customer_reviews.title: Had issues not related to card itself... please read.  Card is great!
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with it working right in Windows 10 (kept saying cable was unplugged). Uninstalled, reinstalled drivers (were recognized right away), thought I had junk... my PC has built in nic and wireless... Finally I moved to the next port on the motherboard and have not had an issue since. I guess I had an IRQ issue. This is no fault of the card... just a motherboard issue (on HP desktop). I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Psoup

customer_reviews.title: Typical, common Realtek chipset
customer_reviews.text: Very common and typical mid-level Realtek chipset. Unfortunately the same chipset I already had in the PC. It's the RTL8168/8111 series which according to Realtek's description are almost identical. Too common apparently.
customer_reviews.author: videobruce

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my wifi problem
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about this card. First of all it fit like a glove in my Dell desktop. Next the instructions and software were easy to understand, and easy to install. Everything was a step by step by step guide. Did not need to call Tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Russell E. Marooney

customer_reviews.title: I have a great, stable ethernet connection now
customer_reviews.text: I had a desktop (Win10) with a Realtek FE Family Controller network card. After upgrading my router to an Asus RT-AC68U the wired connection to the desktop (near the networking origins) started to drop the connection every few minutes. After trying several things and troubleshooting I replaced the network card with this TP-LINK TG-3468 and the problem is now solved. I have a great, stable ethernet connection now. The only thing is that my Windows 10 PC does not recognize the network card as the TP-LINK. I was unable to install drivers manually. Windows 10 automatically accepted the card and it works. In device manager, it shows up as a newer Realtek card. Strange, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sturmtiger

customer_reviews.title: It's a gigbit ethernet card and it works.
customer_reviews.text: The ethernet circuitry on my motherboard died. So, I disabled it in the bios and installed this PCI ethernet card. Installation was easy, the system immediately recognized it, and it has been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Spacerockfan

customer_reviews.title: Wish the software came with the product...
customer_reviews.text: Compact card that was easy to physically install. The issue I had was getting the drivers and installing them. I prefer to have the whole package in hand when it arrives, but no disc, so I had to go find the drivers on line. Once installed, it does its' thing well enough...
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Perrotta

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Installed to replace a dead port on main board, running windows 8.1, installed card, put in supplied cd, picked model of board and went to windows 8 drivers. Everything up and working in a few minutes, connects to router at gigabit speed. (As noted by the port light on the router) I noticed some negative reviews that said they weren't getting the fast speed, what was it before you put the card in? It's not going to increase your internet speed especially if you don't have a gigabit router since the internet speed is determined by the network your on. It can however increase peer to peer transfers on your local network hooked by Ethernet cables
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old system that blew it's built-in Ethernet adapter, so I had to buy a card. This item was easy to install and works like a charm. I am very pleased and I recommend this to all who need it. You cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great support + No config Ubuntu 14 out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after experiencing the outstanding customer support TPLink gave me when I had problems with their router and port forwarding. I bought this card to replace the Ethernet port in my Gigabyte motherboard died prematurely (is this what Gigabyte means about ultra-durable??). This PC dual boots Xubuntu and Windows 7 so I'm sure it wasn't a software config or update issue. One day the port just woke up dead. I was a little worried because Linux was not mentioned on the box when it arrived, but I'm happy to say my Xubuntu required zero software installation or changes. Just worked as soon as I powered it up.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Tufnel

customer_reviews.title: No Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on my open source firewall (OPNsense) The cards were automatically recognized during install and have been working as expected from day one. So if you are curious if this card/adaptor works with some linux distros.....yes, yes it does.
customer_reviews.author: Poor DJ

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a new Pc, windows 10 found it and installed the needed drivers, it was active within seconds giving me expected downs and ups. I wish all installs were this easy.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics Crazed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement when onboard network card goes south
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent network adapter when the onboard network card fails, as often happens. Pop it in and (in most cases) it just works. Occasionally there can be configuration issues with some operating systems, but on my Linux box there was no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: depscribe

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Compatible with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when a Windows 10 update caused issues with my built in NIC card in my Dell XPS 8000. The card was easy to install and works great withy older dell running Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: very easy to install and set up and it is fast
customer_reviews.text: it is fast my down load speed increase 1/.4 faster. It is easy to install and immediately started to work with windows 10 which made it easy to install the up to date driver from Tp-Link website., It also has a 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install into my old XPS 8300. No issues, windows 10 installed appropriate drivers upon boot-up. Everything works as expected, getting 950 down/up from my fiber network.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: finally off wifi
customer_reviews.text: my kids were taking all my wifi, but their computers weren't recognizing the plugged in internet without these. does the job and now i can watch netflix in the tub without it lagging again lol
customer_reviews.author: Mom3boys

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy replacement for integrated NIC going bad...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a client's PC whose integrated NIC was fried from a lightning strike. This was easy to install and work right away in a Windows 10 PC. No complaints at all and I have a happy client who didn't need to buy a new PC>
customer_reviews.author: mkaxsnyder

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised on Win7 Home Premium 64 - Haven't Tried It Yet on Win10
customer_reviews.text: So far so good on Windows 7 Home Premium 64bit. Seems to work fine with decent transfer speeds. Haven't tried it in Win10 yet. Not the best card out there but for the price, it's hard to go wrong. I did have to use the supplied drivers. For those who report poor speeds, I remind you that you have to take into account the limitations of the other device you're connecting to. I had good results hitting other pc's with fast hard drives, but when connecting to my NAS (gigabit enabled), I had less than stellar transfer speeds because it only has a 5,400 rpm HDD.
customer_reviews.author: ArcticMinibike

customer_reviews.title: Does the TG-3468 really support IEEE802.1q VLAN tagging?
customer_reviews.text: Well, as a standard PCI Express Ethernet adapter it works well. However, it is advertised as supporting IEEE802.1q VLAN tagging and this is the main reason why I purchased it. It doesn't provide any method for setting PVIDs. I read all the FAQ's and went through all the documentation and found nothing on setting it. For other manufactures the settings are found in the device manager with the proper drivers installed. The only setting found in the device manager for the TG-3468 regarding VLANs is enabling it, nothing more. I contacted technical support with the specific question regarding VLAN settings over a month ago and so far silence from them.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: It worked. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Good network adapter for the price. It's using a Realtek chipset so it's good enough for average uses. If you need higher performance or for gaming then it's worth considering a network card with an Intel chipset.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Great compatibility with Pfsense! Comes with low profile AND standard profile brackets!
customer_reviews.text: I built a custom Pfsense box and used one of these for the WAN port. Plug-and-play functionality. No drivers or software installation necessary. I installed it and it worked right out of the box. i didn't even have to configure anything in Pfsense. I just plugged a cat6 cable from my modem to the TP-Link TG-3468 and everything started working right away. I highly recommend this product. It comes with a low profile bracket as well as standard profile. I hope you find this review helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Derek C.

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 - No PROBLEM!
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded to gigabit internet and my onboard broadcom NIC would not get speeds above 300-350mbits. I purchased this NIC in hopes it would solve my problem, AND IT DID! No drivers to install and I instantly got my full internet speeds. If you have a Broadcom Netlink NIC and are having speed issues get this CARD!
customer_reviews.author: hobbyflier

customer_reviews.title: Plug-n-play with multiple OS's
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a friend who needed a simple drop-in card for his Win7 x64 machine. He was able to drop it right in, Windows automagically installed the drivers and he was back online in a matter of minutes. Based on searching for other cards, this one seemed to offer the best chipset and driver compatibility for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and works great!!! Good speeds all the time. I do believe that TP-Link products are just as good as the major brands, they are just a whole lot less in price!!! That is good in my book!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J Walsworth

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap backup for motherboard Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: When my motherboard Ethernet failed, I bought this as a cheap fix. Works great. Has both short and tall mounting brackets. Works on Windows 10 version 2004.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Cimorelli

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for onboard LAN.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older motherboard that was having issues with the built in LAN. Upon every reboot, you would have to reinstall the driver which is a pain. So a simple solution was this basic card. I've had zero issues with it this far and it just works. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: M. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: No issues on a windows 10 PC. I installed, turned the PC on and everything worked. I did go and download/install the cards drivers as well. No problems thus far.
customer_reviews.author: SirJiggles80

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to upgrate your LAN speed
customer_reviews.text: I use older i3 and i5 used computer to build simple media serves. Often these older used machines do not have Gigabit speed network interfaces. These cards have worked for me every time I used them. They are my go to source.
customer_reviews.author: A Partent

customer_reviews.title: this card works great and can give you full gigabit assuming you have ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a Dell Optiplex 380 as my router running pfSense. I recently upgraded to gigabit internet and had a PCI gigabit card as my LAN NIC (the WAN is built in gigabit). I was capped around 640 megabits and figured it might be PCI slowing me down. Purchased this card since its PCI Express and now I can download around 950. So if you have pfSense, this card works great and can give you full gigabit assuming you have no other bottlenecks.
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the ethernet port on my motherboard (Asus Z87-A) keeps dying. The first board failed after only 2 weeks so I was able to exchange it with Amazon. The second board was fine for 3 months until the port stopped working. Rather than send the board in for warranty repairs with Asus, I opted to just buy this card. The card works great out-of-the-box with box Ubuntu 13.10 and Windows 7. No need to install any drivers or anything, just install the card, attach a cable, and turn on the computer. Transfer speeds are excellent and it even comes with a low-profile mounting bracket, if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Substitution
customer_reviews.text: Recently, a lightning storm took out the embedded LAN port on my MSI based PC. I decided to get this TP-Link LAN card and see if it would work. You definitely need a PCI Express slot as the module ONLY fits and express slot. If you have the express slot, then this module is a perfect replacement for the embedded. In fact, my motherboard LAN chipset was only good for 100 Mb. With this module I now have 1 Gb LAN speed into my Gigabit switch. I ran speed tests and I get the full 100 Mbs up and download speeds on my FiOS Quantum. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Rcaman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Unlike Integrated NICs
customer_reviews.text: The integrated network card on my motherboard was exhibiting some strange intermittent failures, and I wasn't quite sure I had nailed down the problem...but sure enough, I popped this thing in there and have had no problems sense. Integrated devices on motherboards suck! I always prefer to put in my own expansion cards, and this is a perfect example.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my computer and turned it on. It worked without having to do anything else. I ran a speed test and it works as advertised. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Works, but seems to cause frequent BSOD
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my reliable Windows 7 64-bit system to take advantage of the 180Mbps Internet connection in our house. But a BSOD happened about once a day after installing. Reluctantly took it back out, and all is well again with the slower 10/100 Ethernet connection built into the motherboard. Bad driver? Who knows, but not worth the system crashes.
customer_reviews.author: MGG Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - Win 10 Easily found card
customer_reviews.text: Card is working well. It was an easy install. My Win 10 PC found the card and automatically installed it. It is working up to snuff. I am very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Waynomo

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a network port on the motherboard that stopped working. Snapped it in and Windows picked it up and used it on the restart. Ran an internet speed test and it was right where it should be. I would turn off the original failed network port in Device Manager but it is no longer detected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Driskell

customer_reviews.title: Trouble free installation.
customer_reviews.text: My recently purchased desktop computer did not have an Ethernet port. WiFi access was slow and trouble some. This unit solved the problem nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Peck

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING customer service, even on a Sunday ! .. no win10 drivers so win10 users keep looking
customer_reviews.text: *Christine's husband here* Hard for me to choose a rating on the card since there are no drivers for windows 10. What I can say is FIVE STARS for TP-Link on customer service. on the box it says 2 year 24/7 support and they DO answer the phone on a Sunday. I was first in line when I called around 11am on a Sunday. Sadly they told me no win10 support so the card is almost worthless to me. IF I had a win8 PC, THIS would be the company I spent my $$ with and so should you.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, easy to install, though it would be nice if it used a chipset that was built-in to Windows 7 so we didn't have to download drivers using a working system. That said, it would be a good idea when purchasing this that you download the drivers ahead of time (to a USB flash drive) so they're easily accessible at the time of installation--I never trust the 5-year-old drivers that are included on the disk in the package. Otherwise, this is an excellent, easy to install and use card and works perfectly at Gigabit speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuwirth

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is a network card my friend. Today technology is so advance that this is just a toy. It worked fine and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Torres

customer_reviews.title: Just Received - Installed
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Appears to be faster that the motherboard LAN adapter. Satisfied for at least an hour. Hope it works this good for a long time!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mvillekd

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest NIC you can get for an ESXi host
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the cheapest NIC you can get for an ESXI host. It comes with the Realtek RT8168 chip, so it is not *officially* supported by ESXi 5.5 BUT they had official support under ESXi 5.0 and 5.1. Basically all you have to do is extract the driver VMware_bootbank_net-r8168_8.013.00-3vmw.510.0.0.799733.vib from 5.1 version, inject it into the 5.5 and you're good to go! I was just looking for a supported NIC that passes traffic, that's all, I'm not concerned with speed at all as it's just a small home lab but so far it's been working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: DSR

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. We have AT&T Uverse 1gbit line and I just ran a test from speedtest.net a few minutes ago and got: 770mbit/sec DOWNLOAD and 773mbit/sec UPLOAD. There are times I've hit nearly 900mbit/sec, so I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Finely, A Product that actually works well!
customer_reviews.text: Installed and worked immediatly! I forgot to turn off auto config on my Vista Machine and Vista installed the necessary driver within a few seconds. I was not able to use the CD due to the speed of my machine installing the driver so fast. I had an instant 1GB connection with an insane amount of packet exchange. This is a Great product! Shipping only took 6 days from ordering over last weekend. Did a couple of test runs transferring large files and downloading/uploading and was very impressed. 2 other gigabit cards previously purchased would not work at these speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R920

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed as my internal Ethernet port stopped working. It was easy to install, just plug and play. I don't use the Wi-Fi as I wanted a direct connection from my cable modem. No Tech Support needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Makoski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: No hastle, good port
customer_reviews.text: My ethernet port suddenly stopped on my business PC, so I ordered this in a rush and chose same day shipping. It came the next morning before noon, no hastle installation just turn off your PC and throw it in an open PCIe slot and boom, no CD or nothing. My only other solution was Wifi, and since the security on Wifi is garbage, this was the cheapest and best solution by far. I get 175mbps download and 25 mbps upload, exactly what i pay for.
customer_reviews.author: RTegland

customer_reviews.title: Effortless install in Windows 8.1, reliable speeds so far
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a windows 8.1 desktop and it was automatically detected by windows and the driver was installed before I could manually do it through the one I got from the website for 8.1 machines. (out of the box it only show support through windows 7). I tried updating the drivers with the one from the website but it showed that windows had infact already installed that same driver. Easiest installation ever. Speeds are up over my previous unit but I don't have a way to benchmark or provide any hard numbers.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy plug and play NIC
customer_reviews.text: I am content with how this Network Interface controller works. I use it to link my PS4 and PC; I can now use remote play without any latency. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Miguel P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great performance, easy to install, strong pickup on signals. Would recommend for anyone who needs to upgrade there motherboard for faster eithernet, or to replace defective nic's
customer_reviews.author: Wired Weasel Computer Services

customer_reviews.title: I run Windows 10 at 64 bit and didn't read all the bad press before I purchased it.
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the warnings. After several months it worked ok except it caused me to have to reload pages or hit the 'refresh' button when I tried to stream. I tried it with 2 different providers. Same problem. It acted like signal throttled up then down or completely stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and it works
customer_reviews.text: Ethernet failed on my motherboard after 5 years, rather than replace the board I got this. Stuck it into an expansion slot (PCIEx1), plugged in the ethernet cable, I'm back online. Didn't need the driver disc, it's got the same chip as my mobo, but it's got one in case you do need it.
customer_reviews.author: greenknight

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I've installed a card. SIMPLE. Programing was was nothing more than following instructions. WiFi has improved and general speed has improved for my "older" computer.
customer_reviews.author: RonR

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my application
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble getting my on-board NIC to work with new Win 10 updates so I bought this card. I ultimately returned it due to difficulties encountered with getting Win 10 to recognize it as anything other than the generic Realtek card which was the problem in the first place. Otherwise it installed easily with no issues other than the inherent Win 10 driver problem.
customer_reviews.author: obrien809

customer_reviews.title: No Mac Address
customer_reviews.text: This card did not come with a MAC address and would not take a static IP or get one from DHCP. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: PCIe Replacement Card
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this PCIe Ethernet Network card to replace on that went ban in my desktop. The installation was simple and took only 5 to 10 minutes. Using Windows 10, I just restarted the computer and everything works perfectly. No software or drivers needed for Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: bathory

product_meta.title: TP-Link 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Ethernet PCI Express, PCIE Network Adapter / Network Card / Ethernet Card for PC, Win10 supported (TG-3468), Model Number: PCI-E
product_meta.description:
Model:Wired Gigabit PCIe Adapter

WHAT THIS PRODUCT DOES
The 32-Bit Gigabit PCI Express Network Adapter TG-3468 allows you to connect a desktop computer to a high-speed wired network. It is a highly integrated and cost-effective Gigabit Ethernet Adapter, and a good choice to upgrade your network.

KEY FEATURES
 * Support 10/100/1000Mbps throughput
 * Support Wake-on-LAN
 * Auto-Negotiation and Auto MDI/MDIX
 * Support IEEE 802.3x Flow Control for Full-duplex Mode and backpressure for Half-duplex Mode
 * Support IEEE 802.1p Layer 2 Priority Encoding and IEEE802.1q VLAN tagging
 * Support power down/link down power saving
 * Support Windows XP 32/64bit, Vista 32/64bit, Windows 7 32/64bit, Windows 8 32/64bit

PACKAGE CONTENTS
 * PCI Express Adapter TG-3468
 * Low-profile Bracket
 * Quick Installation Guide
 * Resource CD
feature_bullets: Ultra Fast: 10/100/1000Mbps PCIe Adapter upgrade your Ethernet speed to Gigabit
Automation: Wake on LAN supporting Auto Negotiation and Auto MDI/MDIX
Supports: IEEE802.3x Flow Control for Full duplex Mode and backpressure for Half duplex Mode; 4k Bytes Port: 1x 10/100/1000Mbps RJ45 Network Media
Dual Bracket: Low profile and standard profile bracket inside works with both mini and standard size PCs
Industry Leading Support: 2 year warranty and free 24/7 technical support
From Reliable Brand: TP Link has been ranked as the World’s No. 1 provider of WLAN products for the past consecutive 7 years by IDC. In 2017
To be eligible for TP Link's Warranty, please confirm and purchase from "Sold by Amazon"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,394 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
